tomconn.growthapi.base

Interface IEventManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEventManager

    public interface IEventManager
    Classes implementing this interface are supposed to handle the passed events in the respective method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<IEventHandler> getAllHandlers()
      Returns an unmodifiable list with all currently registered handlers

    • Method Detail

      • getHandlerForEvent

        default <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> IEventHandler<E,?> getHandlerForEvent(java.lang.Class<E> e)
        Returns the handler for the specified event
        Type Parameters:
        E - Any variation of Event
        Parameters:
        e - then event class
        Returns:
        The registered IEventHandler for e

      • registerEventHandler

        <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> boolean registerEventHandler(IEventHandler<E,?> handler,
                                                                                          java.lang.Class<E> eventClass)
        Registers a new handler for the given Event if there isn't already one registered
        Type Parameters:
        E - the Event
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler
        eventClass - then class of the event
        Returns:
        true if the handler was successfully registered, false if not so

      • unregisterEventHandler

        default <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> boolean unregisterEventHandler(@Nonnull
                                                                                                    IEventHandler<E,?> handler)
        Tries to unregister a present handler based on the passed handler reference.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Any variation of Event
        Parameters:
        handler - An instance of IEventHandler
        Returns:
        True if and only if the passed instance was registered in this IEventManager and it was successfully removed, false otherwise

      • unregisterEventHandler

        default <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> IEventHandler<E,?> unregisterEventHandler(@Nonnull
                                                                                                               java.lang.Class<E> eventClass)
        Tries to unregister one present handler based on the passed event-class.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Any variation of Event
        Parameters:
        eventClass - The event-class of which a present handler shall be removed
        Returns:
        The registered event-handler if and only if there was a handler registered for the passed class
        null otherwise

      • unregisterEventHandler

        <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> IEventHandler<E,?> unregisterEventHandler(@Nullable
                                                                                                       IEventHandler<E,?> handler,
                                                                                                       @Nullable
                                                                                                       java.lang.Class<E> eventClass)
        Tries to unregister a present handler based on the passed handler reference.
        If there is no such handler, the currently for eventClass registered handler will be unregistered
        Type Parameters:
        E - Any variation of Event
        Parameters:
        handler - An instance of IEventHandler
        eventClass - An class derived by Event
        Returns:
        The respective unregistered handler, null if there was no handler registered for the class

      • manage

        default <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> void manage(E event)
        Handles Forge Events
        Type Parameters:
        E - any variation of Event
        Parameters:
        event - the event

      • getAllHandlers

        java.util.List<IEventHandler> getAllHandlers()
        Returns an unmodifiable list with all currently registered handlers
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of all currently registered IEventHandler

      • hasHandlerFor

        default <E extends net.minecraftforge.fml.common.eventhandler.Event> boolean hasHandlerFor(java.lang.Class<E> eventclass)
        Checks whether there is already a IEventHandler which handles instances of the passed event class
        Type Parameters:
        E - any variation of Event
        Parameters:
        eventclass - the class of the event
        Returns:
        true if and only if there is a handler which would handle events of the passed event class
